Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule

Class Schedule

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule.Schedule
public class Schedule extends Object
The functionality of Schedule is very similar to the functionality in WolfScheduler from the Guided Projects. You are welcome to reuse code from the Guided Projects to help with implementing Schedule.
Author:
Kevin John, Elijah Montgomery, Damion Winders

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Schedule()
    Constructs a Schedule object by reading course information from a file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Schedule

      public Schedule()
      Constructs a Schedule object by reading course information from a file.

  • Method Details

    • getScheduledCourses

      public String[][] getScheduledCourses()
      Retrieves the scheduled courses as a 2D array of strings.
      Returns:
      A 2D array where each row represents a scheduled course with columns for name, section, and title.

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Retrieves the schedule title
      Returns:
      a string for the title

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course course)
      Adds a course to the schedule based on its name and section.
      Parameters:
      course - The course to be added to the schedule.
      Returns:
      true if the course was successfully added to the schedule, false if the course was not found in the catalog.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the course with the same name and section is already in the schedule.

    • removeCourseFromSchedule

      public boolean removeCourseFromSchedule(Course course)
      Schedule.removeCourseFromSchedule(Course) should remove the Course from the schedule and return true if the Course was removed and false if there was not a Course to remove.
      Parameters:
      course - the course to be removed
      Returns:
      false if it did not remove

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(String title)
      Schedule.setTitle(String) should set the title to the parameter value. If the title is null, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with the messages “Title cannot be null.”.
      Parameters:
      title - The title to be set for the schedule. It should not be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided title is null.

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      resets schedule by creating a new empty list

    • getScheduleCredits

      public int getScheduleCredits()
      Retrieves the total credits of all courses in the schedule.
      Returns:
      the total credits in the schedule

    • canAdd

      public boolean canAdd(Course c)
      returns true if the Course can be added to the schedule. If the Course is null, if the Course is already in the schedule, or if there is a conflict, canAdd() will return false.
      Parameters:
      c - Course
      Returns:
      if the course can be added to schedule
